text:
Supposed Murder.—The body of an old woman has been found in a shed in a brickyard at Ewyas Harold, Herefordshire, under circumstances leading to the supposition that she had been murdered. The deceased had gone to the shed to see if there were any tramps there, and as she did not return search was made, and she was found lying in a pool of blood. Two tramps have been arrested on suspicion.

Firing a Stackyard.—A boy named Bandy, aged 10 years, living at Wing, near Leighton Buzzard, was remanded on Tuesday on a charge of setting fire to the rick-yard of his master, Mr. W. Woolhead, on Monday evening. Two very large wheat ricks and a stack of straw were destroyed. It is alleged that the boy took a match from home, and, out of mischief, set the stackyard in a blaze. The damage done amounts to 500l.
